archetype.archetype_expression: The wise witch who remembers what it was like to be new. Transforms curiosity into practice through patient guidance. Never condescending, always empowering. Treats the craft with reverence but makes it accessible.

soul.one_sentence: An ancient grimoire reimagined for the digital age, where every scroll reveals a secret.
soul.expanded: This is the candlelit sanctuary where seekers become practitioners. We honor the old ways while speaking in modern tongues. Every visitor is treated as a future member of the craft, deserving of respect and real knowledge—not watered-down spirituality or dangerous misinformation.
soul.what_we_are: The trusted guide into authentic witchcraft practice. A bridge between ancient wisdom and modern seekers. A community that takes the craft seriously while remaining warm and welcoming.
soul.what_we_are_not: Not a trendy aesthetic. Not 'witch-lite' for Instagram. Not appropriative of closed practices. Not fear-mongering or dark for darkness's sake. Not a marketplace first.

if_this_site_were.person: A wise woman in her 40s-50s who has practiced for decades. Silver streaks in dark hair, warm eyes that have seen much. She welcomes you into her cottage filled with herbs, books, and candles. She speaks slowly, thoughtfully, and never rushes. She remembers her own beginning and treats your questions with respect.
if_this_site_were.place: A candlelit study in an old cottage. Bookshelves line the walls, filled with leather-bound volumes and glass jars of herbs. A fire crackles low. Dried flowers hang from wooden beams. Moonlight filters through leaded glass windows. It smells of sage, old paper, and beeswax.
if_this_site_were.time_of_day: The blue hour—just after sunset when the veil between day and night is thin. The moment when candles become necessary and shadows become interesting.
if_this_site_were.season: Late autumn, when the world turns inward. Leaves have fallen, nights are long, the time for introspection and study has arrived.
if_this_site_were.sound: A fire crackling softly. Pages turning. Wind chimes in the distance. A cat purring. Occasional owl. No modern sounds—no notifications, no traffic.
if_this_site_were.texture: Aged leather book covers, smooth from centuries of hands. Rough-woven linen. Warm candle wax. Cool crystal. Dried herb bundles. Handmade paper.
if_this_site_were.smell: Dried lavender and rosemary. Old books. Beeswax candles. Wood smoke. A hint of earth after rain. Chamomile tea.
if_this_site_were.taste: Herbal tea with honey. Mulled wine. Dark chocolate. Something comforting and slightly mysterious.
if_this_site_were.temperature: Warm from the fire against cool autumn air seeping through old windows. Cozy but not stifling.
if_this_site_were.weather: A clear night with visible stars and moon, perhaps with mist settling in the garden.
if_this_site_were.music_genre: Ambient/ethereal—artists like Wardruna, Enya's more mystical tracks, or medieval/folk instrumentals. Never modern pop. Never aggressive.
if_this_site_were.movie: Practical Magic meets The Secret Garden—mystical but grounded, magical but relatable.
if_this_site_were.book: A well-worn grimoire passed down through generations, filled with handwritten notes in the margins from practitioners past.

primary_persona.name: Curious Clara
primary_persona.description: A woman who has always felt drawn to something more. She's done some reading, maybe owns a few crystals or tarot cards, but doesn't know where to start with actual practice. She's intelligent, somewhat skeptical of 'woo-woo' content, and wants substance over aesthetics.
primary_persona.mindset: Seeking but cautious. Doesn't want to do anything 'wrong' or disrespectful. Worried about cultural appropriation. Wants to feel like she belongs somewhere.
goals: Learn authentic witchcraft from trustworthy source
Find practices that fit her life
pain_points: Can't tell authentic from fake sources
Feels silly admitting interest to others
objections: Is this site going to try to sell me expensive courses?
Is this real information or made-up nonsense?
Will I be judged for being a beginner?
trigger_phrases: how to know if you're a witch

secondary_persona.name: Returning Rebecca
secondary_persona.description: A woman who practiced years ago but life got in the way. Now she's ready to return but feels rusty and wonders what's changed. She needs a refresher without feeling talked down to.
secondary_persona.how_they_differ: Has baseline knowledge but needs updating and confidence rebuilding

tertiary_persona.name: Curious Chris
tertiary_persona.description: A man interested in witchcraft but unsure if it's 'for him' given the feminine-coded content he's encountered. Looking for inclusive, non-gendered approach to the craft.
tertiary_persona.how_they_differ: Needs to see himself represented, reassured that witchcraft isn't exclusively feminine

anti_persona.description: Someone looking to curse enemies, summon demons, or practice 'dark magic' for harmful purposes. Also: people looking only for aesthetic content without substance.
anti_persona.why_not: We don't serve harmful intentions. We're not an aesthetic Pinterest board.

visual_philosophy.overall_aesthetic: Ancient wisdom meets digital clarity—a grimoire that loads fast

density.description: Spacious with intention. Content breathes like the pauses between incantations.
density.section_breathing: Generous gaps between sections. Each section is a chamber in a larger temple.
density.never: Never cramped. Never 'above the fold' anxiety. Never wall-of-text.

contrast.description: High contrast but warm. Dark backgrounds with warm light emerging.
contrast.approach: Light comes from within—candlelit, not spotlit. Content emerges from shadow.
contrast.drama_level: High drama, low aggression. Theatrical but not startling.
contrast.never: Never flat gray. Never harsh white. Never clinical bright.

motion.description: Slow, deliberate, organic. Like candle flames and turning pages.
motion.speed: Slow—0.5s minimum for meaningful transitions, 0.8s-1.2s for reveals
motion.style: Organic easing, never mechanical. Fade and emerge, not slide and bounce.
motion.frequency: Rare but meaningful. Every animation has purpose.
motion.purpose: To create atmosphere, never to impress with tech
motion.never: Never bouncy. Never flashy. Never attention-demanding. Never parallax for parallax's sake.

texture.intensity: Subtle—felt more than seen. 5-10% opacity textures.
texture.never: Never shiny. Never plastic. Never perfectly clean digital.

shape_language.primary_shapes: Organic curves with intentional imperfection. Slightly asymmetric.
shape_language.border_radius_philosophy: Soft but not bubbly. 4-8px, never 16px+ rounded pills.
shape_language.line_weight: Medium to thin. Delicate but not fragile.
shape_language.never: Never perfectly geometric. Never harsh 90° corners. Never pill-shaped buttons.

depth.approach: Layered with atmospheric depth. Content floats above misty backgrounds.
depth.shadow_style: Soft, large, low-opacity. Atmospheric, not drop-shadow.
depth.elevation_levels: 3 levels: deep background, mid-ground content, foreground focus
depth.never: Never flat. Never hard drop shadows. Never material design elevation.

required_flow: Atmospheric hero with emergence effect—the threshold moment
Invitation to begin (for new visitors)—clear beginner path
Topic exploration—discover the branches of practice

hero_requirements.cta_style: Single inviting CTA, not commanding. Lower third.

category_pages.featured_treatment: Top 1-3 posts significantly larger, editorial selection

single_posts.sidebar_usage: None on articles—full focus on content
single_posts.related_content_style: Curated 'Continue Your Journey' section, 3 posts max

grid_philosophy.asymmetry_level: High—vary card heights, feature some content larger
grid_philosophy.grid_breaking: Every 6-8 cards, break with full-width element or featured content

spacing_rhythm.breathing_rule: When in doubt, add more space. Content should never feel cramped.

responsive_philosophy.mobile_approach: Simplified but still atmospheric. Emergence effects reduced. Touch-optimized.
responsive_philosophy.breakpoint_behavior: Graceful degradation—mobile is simpler, not broken desktop

navigation.philosophy: Discovery—navigation is an invitation to explore, not a directory

primary_nav.item_naming_style: Inviting, not clinical. 'Begin Here' not 'Getting Started'. 'Moon Magic' not 'Lunar Content'.
primary_nav.dropdown_behavior: Simple dropdowns, not mega menus. Keep mystery—don't reveal everything.

mobile_nav.maintains_atmosphere: Dark background, items emerge like content. Navigation is a moment, not a utility.

breadcrumbs.style: Subtle, above title. 'Home / Moon Magic / Full Moon Ritual'

search.prominence: Present in header, subtle until focused
search.style: Expands on focus, placeholder: 'Search spells, rituals, guides...'

headings.personality: Ancient, elegant, authoritative but not cold. The font of grimoire titles.
headings.text_transform: None for most, small-caps for special emphasis

body.personality: Readable, warm, literary. The font of well-loved books.

accent.usage: Pull quotes, special callouts, ritual instructions
accent.restraint_rule: Max 1-2 uses per page. Special, not common.

secondary_accent.usage: Handwritten notes, 'blessed be' signatures, personal touches
secondary_accent.restraint_rule: Very rare. Only for genuinely handwritten feel.

background_primary.name: Night Sky
background_primary.emotion: Deep night, mystery, the void before creation

approved_gradients: Vignette: transparent center to dark edges
Candle glow: subtle warm radial in hero areas

illustration_style.color_usage: Monochrome or limited palette matching brand
illustration_style.style_reference: Vintage botanical prints, medieval manuscripts, astronomical charts

iconography.style: Custom line icons with slight imperfection

image_treatment.borders: None or very subtle, never thick frames
image_treatment.shapes: Soft edges, occasional mask to organic shape

must_include.description: Current moon phase displayed subtly, connecting site to lunar cycle
Subtle warm glow suggesting candlelight presence
Content appearing from darkness like secrets revealed
must_include.frequency: First meaningful interaction on each page

usage_rules.restraint_philosophy: These elements are special because they're rare. Overuse makes them ordinary.

custom_ui_elements.buttons: Soft edges, subtle glow on hover, text feels handwritten or ancient
custom_ui_elements.cards: Slight parchment texture, soft shadow, content emerges from darkness
custom_ui_elements.dividers: Decorative botanical or celestial, never plain lines
custom_ui_elements.loading_states: Candle flame animation or moon phase cycle
custom_ui_elements.empty_states: Mystical messaging with invitation to explore

writing_style.sentence_length: Varied—short for emphasis, longer for explanation
writing_style.paragraph_length: 3-4 sentences typical, never walls of text

voice.perspective: Second person (you) for instructions, first person (we) for community
forbidden_phrases: Secret that experts don't want you to know

layout_forbidden: Generic blog grid as main content
this_site_specific_forbidden: Appropriation of closed practices (Voodoo, Hoodoo without proper attribution)
immediate_rejection_triggers: Looks like a WordPress theme demo
Could work on any spiritual site

what_cheap_looks_like: Centered text on dark purple background
Stock witch image with gradient overlay
Generic '3 reasons to practice witchcraft' cards
what_perfect_looks_like: Visitor pauses on arrival—atmosphere is tangible
Content emerges like secrets being revealed
Typography feels like reading an ancient book
Color palette creates warmth in darkness
Every element serves the mystical immersion
A designer would screenshot it for inspiration
You can FEEL the candle warmth through the screen

tests.screenshot_test: Would a professional designer save this to their inspiration folder?
tests.swap_test: Could this design work on a generic spiritual site? (Must fail)
tests.memory_test: What specific element will visitors remember in a week?
tests.ten_second_test: Can a visitor feel the mystical atmosphere within 10 seconds?
tests.grandmother_test: If someone's skeptical grandmother saw this, would she think it's 'a real website' or 'spooky nonsense'?

competitive_positioning.how_we_differ: We prioritize atmosphere and experience over information density. Quality over quantity. Journey over destination.
competitive_positioning.what_they_do_wrong: Information overload, no editorial curation, clinical presentation, no emotional connection
competitive_positioning.what_we_do_better: Immersive experience, careful curation, warm guidance, authentic community

seo.internal_linking_strategy: Hub and spoke from pillar pages. Every post links to its pillar. Pillars link to each other.
seo.content_depth_target: Pillar: 3000-5000 words | Hub: 1500-2500 words | Spoke: 1000-2000 words | Support: 500-1000 words

changelog.changes: Complete DNA overhaul with comprehensive sections

planned_evolutions: Add moon phase API integration specifications
experiments_to_try: Personalized content based on practice level
